compares it to the 230 plus aws best practice checks that we've learned uh by
leveraging aws's operational history serving hundreds of thousands of customers
then it provides recommended actions based on three scoring criteria
a green result typically means that a no problem is detected
a yellow result means that an investigation is recommended to determine if further review is needed
and a red result means that action is recommended to address the potential critical findings now checks are grouped
into four different categories or pillars if you call it cost optimization
performance security and fault tolerance and in each of these four areas uh we
identify areas of opportunities improvements and uh in the fifth category to monitor service limits when
the service usage is more than eighty percent of your service limit
